awd_titl_txt: Introductory Manufacturing Laboratory in Aerospace          Engineering
awd_abstract_narration: A three-axis numerically controlled mill and a computer-aided                   manufacturing system is integrated with an existing computer-                   aided design capability to give undergraduate students the                      ability to design and manufacture complex parts. This                           capability is directly incorporated into at least two courses                   in the form of manufacturing experiments. One laboratory                        experiment insures that every undergraduate has at least once,                  prior to graduation, designed, manufactured, and tested a                       component part. The second manufacturing experiment is used to                  test a student's ability to design optimal parts. The                           manufacturing capability will further enable prototyping and                    construction of complex aerodynamtc models that have been                       conceived of, in any of the presently offered design and                        student project courses.

inst.inst_name: Regents of the University of Michigan - Ann Arbor
